stimulus:
Welcome to the experiment.

Press any key to begin.

This experiment aims to measure humans' visual reasoning skills. You will go through a practice session consisting of 3 trials, followed by 6 blocks of 21 trials.

When presented with an empty square in the middle of the screen, place your cursor on it to start the trial.

4 images will appear on the screen. 3 out of 4 images were generated with a certain rule while one image (the odd one out) does not respect this rule.

Select the odd one out by clicking on the image.

Following your choice, you will be asked to rate how confident you were about your choice on a scale from 0 to 100. Then, you will receive feedback on the trial.

The 21 trials of a block use the same rule and each block uses a different rule. At the end of each block, you will asked to describe the rule before starting a new block.

Please do not take breaks only in between blocks not in between trials.

The following 3 trials will allow you to get familiar with the odd-one-out task. The experiment starts after this practice session.

Press any button to continue

Instruction Check: The tasks consists of choosing one image that's different from the other three.
